conclusion: The mass of block A is M = 4m, and the mass of cylinder B is m.
In Figure A, block A is on an inclined plane with θ = 37°.
In Figure B, block A is on an inclined plane with θ = 30° and a cylinder B is between A and the plane.
For θ = 37°, the forces on block A are gravitational force Mg, normal force N, and frictional force f.
The component of gravitational force parallel to the plane is Mg sin(37°), and normal force is Mg cos(37°).
Since block A is at rest, frictional force f balances the gravitational component: f = Mg sin(37°).
For θ = 30°, the forces on block A are gravitational force Mg, normal force N, frictional force f, and normal force from cylinder B, N_B.
The component of gravitational force parallel to the plane is Mg sin(30°), and normal force is Mg cos(30°).
Since block A is at rest, frictional force f balances the gravitational component: f = Mg sin(30°).
The friction force of A on the slope when θ = 30° is 2mg.
